Reviews.Title: “Very good.”
Reviews.Author: dgauss
Reviews.Content: Convenient location close to airport and beaches. About the most likeable staff we encountered on the island. Some free parking adjacent to the hotel. Many restaurants within easy walking. Cockfight arena just across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Great Price, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Troy S
Reviews.Content: Loved it here for the night I stayed, the rate was great and the staff was awesome. Room was clean and location was great. Id go again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Villa Del sole excellent little getaway.”
Reviews.Author: john647
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Villa Del sole is an excellent little getaway very close to the beaches next to a Walgreens, they also have car rentals SUV rentals, bicycle rentals reasonably priced rooms, very close to all the others establishments as well as five minutes from the airport a refreshing pool a full-service bar that serves breakfast and lunch and dinner just ask for Carmen she will cook you up an excellent meal, or mix you up a refreshing great drink, a must visit place with great service friendly staff, and clean rental cars.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE! HORRIBLE SERVICE! BEDBUGS!”
Reviews.Author: baclayton
Reviews.Content: I took my sister to Puerto Rico for a girls getaway and we stayed at the Hotel Villa de Sol. We chose the hotel because it was affordable and the pictures of the rooms and bright yellow Spanish style building won us over. We were EXTREMELY disappointed! Let me first say that... IT LOOKS NOTHING LIKE THE PICTURES advertised on the internet. The bar and restaurant were closed the entire time we were there. When we got to our room it was hot and muggy because the a/c had not been turned on as a courtesy and the room reeked of some sort of perfume/disinfectant. The table and chairs on our balcony were covered in mildew. The headboards and frames on our beds were not secured, the pillows were flat, the bed was terribly uncomfortable and we woke up our first morning there with bites on our legs, arms and torso! OMG!... The iron was broken, the ironing board cover was covered in stains and don't even think about asking for extra towels or pillows! They acted as if I were asking for their first born! It was two of us and only one small hand towel. I love my sister but neither of us desired to share the same washcloth. Our room didn't get cleaned until late in the afternoon, and again two people, one washcloth. It was close to the airport so we knew we'd hear airplanes go by... but nothing could have prepared us for what we heard. We could have sworn that the planes literally taking off on the same street! We paid $109 a night, but it was worth every bit of $50 bucks a night. I'm a flight attendant and I'm usually in and out of hotels up to 20 times a month and this was by far THE WORST PLACE EVER!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay- affordable- low key”
Reviews.Author: yasmine1982
Reviews.Content: pros: open style hotel- nice staff- rooms were clean, clean pool, a/c working, great location walking distance to beach nigthlife resturants supermarket and casinos..... no problems with water or any type of bugs and was staying on 2nd floor-- we took 3 rooms and didnt have a prob with any.. loved their little cat that sleeps in the lobby near the pool- i call it the cat the hotels mascot-as they have a name for her-pet lover here! cons- no elevators- had to walk to room on second floor via stairs.. food ordered from bar took a long time- no place to park... we stayed on the second floor and had no problems... the pool closes early and of course if you are looking for a 5 star hotel with perfect service this is not the hotel for you.. but if you are on a budget and just need to spend a few days to tour the island and visit its great!! i have read a few reviews and never realized how picky people can be when paying $100-$120 a night in a tourist area where the surrounding hotel are a min of $250 a night... umm what do you expect? how the rooms were painted and if the blinds were not opening and if the towel holder was loose is really not a priority of mines when i stay at a hoteel.. but i could guarantee that it was clean and affordable and the staff ladies were friendly...

Reviews.Title: “$90 a night for a dirty, smelly room”
Reviews.Author: corela
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Villa del Sol for 1 night. The room was smelly, dirty carpet, noisy AC, small bathroom, sheets had stains, thin pillows, there were tiny ants on the wall I called the front desk and the lady offered to sprayed insecticide! chairs in the room were old and dirty, chairs in the balcony moldy. I was very dissapointed with the poor condition of the room. There are no elevators. My husband is an early bird person and got up early the next morning to get breakfast and the restaurant was not open. Would not recommend this hotel to anybody.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel EVER!!!”
Reviews.Author: Michelle224
Reviews.Content: I am not one to be picky or one to give bad reviews, but this hotel has given me nothing but hell from stepping my foot into the lobby. Rooms has roaches, bed bugs, smallest TV, bathroom was gross. We requested a full refund, which we recieved, after waiting a few days to get it, after having to call our bank and have them release our money. They have a car rental associated with them as well and they charged me for security without notifying me. The car was full of rode ants that got into my daughters car seat. They held money for security for the car, that I still havent gotten back a week later. Dont waste your time or money! It will ruin your trip coming here!

Reviews.Title: “Bedbugs, other problems. Some good stuff. Mixed.”
Reviews.Author: Bnad
Reviews.Content: It's rare to actually see bedbugs. But I saw one here. Had my hand resting on the counter while my fingers worked the channel button on the TV (since there was no TV remote in the room) and one of the little suckers crawled out from under the TV. It looked exactly like http://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/6/69/DSCF0005.JPG. Squished it and then followed my new personal procedure (thought up right then) for staying in hotels with confirmed bedbug sightings: all bags and clothes onto the fold down bench in the shower, and sleep with the light on. When I first arrived at this hotel there was a man ahead of me in reception complaining that the hotel had left his family's bags at the airport for 4 days after having promised to deliver them to his room. The receptionist's response was glib--something like "well, you have them now, so it all worked out in the end!" No apology. For me this was a last minute booking to save me from having to spend the night in the airport, so I tried not to judge. The man then said, "this is an interesting hotel you run here. When I was here at 4pm there were four girls sitting at the bar drinking margaritas. Well, those same four girls are still here drinking the same margaritas!" (It was then about 10pm.) There were indeed four pretty girls sitting at the end of the bar laughing with each other. I imagine that they were hired by the place to sit there, be pretty, and bring in traffic. My room was on the first floor behind the receptionist and the door slid open and closed. There was an alarm clock in the room but it was stuck at 12:00 and the time set buttons didn't work. The bathroom was very clean and the rest of the room looked clean enough (until the bedbug crawled out). There was a working minifridge in the room, and the TV gets 100 cable channels. The receptionist delivered the wake up call on time. The shower is a walk in and the bathroom was handicap accessible, with railings and a fold down shower bench. Water pressure was good. Soap & shampoo were provided. Towels were clean & plentiful. Street noise wasn't too bad and what noise there was could be drowned out with the window air conditioner. My #2 recommendation for improving this room, after fumigating the whole hotel for bedbugs, would be to get a working remote for the TV and put it in the room. #3 would be a working alarm clock.

Reviews.Title: “We liked it!!”
Reviews.Author: Tiffany627
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at the Hotel Villa del Sol and we thought it was great. We stayed in room 205 and it was very clean, did not stink, and had no bugs. The air conditioner worked and our water pressure although not very strong, did the job (The water pressure throughout the entire island is not strong so I do not blame the hotel). We thought the hotel was very cute but wished that the pool did not close as early as it does which is 6 pm. The lady at the bar is VERY nice and made me a great pina colada and a delicious burger for my friend. Overall, I have no complaints and plan on going back to the island next year and staying at the Hotel Villa del Sol with my husband.

Reviews.Title: “Don't do it!”
Reviews.Author: bufffan08
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel on the recommendation of relatives that live in Puerto Rico. (I'm thinking they picked it just because, not because they'd had any dealings with the hotel) Anyway, the hotel has a lot of charm and is clean (except for the carpet) with a friendly and helpful staff, but that's as much praise as I'll give it. Our room was SMALL and musty smelling. There were those little tiny black ants in the bathroom. The knob on the bathroom sink came off with a lift. The shower handle was a challenge. There wasn't much play to the handle. The first night my husband ended up taking a cold shower because he hadn't figured out the trick to get the handle to turn in order to have hot water. The two other groups of family members staying at the hotel didn't get a shower the first night, because the hotels power went off/surged for a moment, thus rendering the hotel "waterless" for a couple of hours, apparently a common accurance. Thin pillows like the other review said. Also, amazed that there are no hand towels and only one wash cloth besides the two bath towels and bath mat. The street noise, people walking by talking, etc. are very noticable, as if the window were open when it wasn't. And to finish, we were there for four nights, and on the last night, I discovered the carpet is in desperate need of a shampooing. I put on a pair of socks after a day on the beach and had them on maybe, ten minutes, and had made a few trips "around" the room, back and forth to the bathroom, etc. then sat down on the bed and caught a look at the bottom of my feet--my white socks were black, YUCK! I'm glad that I hadn't noticed this on the first day, 'cause that would of made the stay that much worse, knowing what I was walking on and going to be walking on for the rest of my vacation. Similar complaints from our other family members staying at the hotel. I'd never stay there again...charm is wonderful, but so are a ton of other things.

Reviews.Title: “don't go to Villa Del Sol”
Reviews.Author: teacherp
Reviews.Content: I was very disappointed with this hotel. The towel rack fell on my head and was never fixed! The water pressure was very low. Our room was extremely small & was not cleaned every day. The bar tender was not fluent in English, but was very pushy about ordering food. We were told we couldn't bring snacks to the pool, we had to order off of the menu. Our in-laws room had ants & a bucket under the toilet because it leaked. Some of our family were told they had to pay more for their room when they checked in & they didn't want to give receipts for cash payments!

Reviews.Title: “Nice & Friendly”
Reviews.Author: ruthie05
Reviews.Content: I was a little concerned when I read the reviews from Hotel Villa De Sol, after I had already made my reservations. I read how the staff, was unfriendly, and how the rooms were not in the best of shapes. Although itâ€™s every one person opinion, the reviews worried and scarred me to possibly canceling and going with a higher priced Hotel in the area. Since this was my first trip to the Island I wanted it to be nice, something I can talk to my friends about. After considering it for a long time, I decided to keep the reservation. To my surprise I was happy that I did not cancel. The hotel was lovely, the front desk staff were very friendly, especially the lady that serves in the bar area. (Loved the coffee she made), the price was great, comparing the surrounding hotels. The room was clean, and the bed made daily. The bathroom was cleaned and had hot water. I have seen worse!! In the time that I was there I did not see any type of bugs in the room, which I was very very happy about. I would have to say that they do not have the best parking arrangement, but since I did not have a car I was not worried about that. Iâ€™m planning my next trip, this time Iâ€™m staying longer, and I will defiantly stay at Hotel Villa Del Sol.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: canukpq
Reviews.Content: We booked this property on line, after looking at the pictures and wanting to stay in a quaint hotel rather then the big ones as we always do on Holiday. We were coming off a cruise and spending 4 days to relax in Puerto Rico and visit the Rain Forest and old San Juan. The Hotel appearance was everything we imagined when we checked in early, paid for the 4 days and were told our room would be ready much later. We strolled the area and visited the casino at Hotel El San Juan and arrived back at the hotel to visit our room. What a disappointment. No chair to sit on, a mattress that has had its day and squeaked every time you sat on it. One pillow per person that was so thin I have no idea who was able to use it as a pillow. We requested a second pillow and were given ones the same of which we had in the room. It would take at least 6 pillows to make up for a normal pillow that people actually use. For 2 people we were given 1 face cloth, 2 bath towels and a floor mat. Imagine 1 face cloth for 2 people, how disgusting. When my wife went to take a shower,as there was no bath, the shower was not functioning properly and we were told that the water pressure was not good, even though the pressure was good at the sink. It was almost impossible to take a shower. We made do, but would never recommend this property to a living soul. When we asked if they had a shuttle to the airport, the response was only if you rent a car from us. We never had any use for a car and found it weird that no shuttle for guests, but if you rent a car you get shuttle service. Well whatever. I sincerely hope that you make mention of this letter to the Hotel and perhaps they will improve.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Service”
Reviews.Author: InspectHotel
Reviews.Content: Small bed room, really small bath room. No elevators, and no body help you with your luggage. At the front desk the service is terrible, they say they have free parking (if you are lucky, you get block the car of another customer). No room service, the TV is small. I paid in cash and leaved a deposit wich they told me they will send it back to me, I`m still waiting for it. Not expensive, but there are better places to stay for a little more.

Reviews.Title: “save yourself”
Reviews.Author: sunkissedPR
Reviews.Content: Booked to stay here for 4 nghts and they gave us a horrible room 2 feet from a pool and a super noisy bar. (that looked like it could be a cleaning closet) checked out the next morning. BTW pictures on the website are decieving

Reviews.Title: “Horrible - Stay Elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: Frequent-Flyer-Mommy
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here from July 12-15. We had 3 rooms booked. One that slept 6 and the other 2 that were double rooms. The room we originally were given had water stains on the ceiling and a very musky smell. Upon entering the room I went to the bathroom to wash my daughters face and realized there was very little water pressure. By very little I mean a trickle. There was no way someone could bathe (much less 6 people). I immediately went to the desk and explaiend the problem. They seemed aware of it but the gist of our conversation was there was no way it would be fixed before our stay was over. I requested another room and was offered one on the first floor that only had 2 beds in it with the promise of 2 cots. The room was next to the bar and extremely noisy. Under normal circumstances this would not have bothered me but with all the other issues this just added to my displeasure here. I called the owner and complained. She was not in any way apologetic and when I threatened to leave she said they would charge me for the 3 nights. The other two rooms were musky and generally in poor condition. I travel to Puerto Rico about 4-5 times a year and have stayed at many hotels both budget and higher end resorts. I wanted to try this place as the website made it look very decent. Basic accomodations are never a problem for me as long as the hotel is clean and the service is adequate. Here neither is the case.This was, quite possibly, the worst service I have ever received. The front desk staff was rude and unresponsive, the manager was just as bad, and the owner was indifferent. I was embarrassed as I was travelling with people that had never been to the island and they were left with a bad impression of the service provided in hotels. If this is your budget then stay at the Coral Princess in Condado. Same prices and much better service.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Experience Spud Island PEI Canada”
Reviews.Author: SPUDISLANDER1
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a week in Puerto Rico. Stayed at the Villa del Sol 3 nights and rented a car from them to tour the island. I must say that we were very pleased with the service from both the hotel staff and the car rental. When we got there we had unknowingly reserved the smallest room they had but since we were renting a car they upgraded us to a very nice room with a balcony overlooking the pool. The hotel is just up the street from the beach and close to all amenities.Yes the planes do make quite a noise from their engines however they stop around 10:00 and we had no problem sleeping.The beds were very comfortable and the staff were extremely friendly. We would certainly stay here again and would also recommend it to our friends. The only complaint that I have is that there is no elevator which makes carrying bags up to the second floor hard but there were no elevators in the other hotels we stayed in either.

Reviews.Title: “I love this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: mianewyork
Reviews.Content: I have stay at this hotel twice, I like better then the big hotels, makes me feel at home. Staff is very friendly. I would recommend it to couples and families with children. Brooklyn, Ny.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice pool area”
Reviews.Author: OpinionsfromTampa
Reviews.Content: This hotel has friendly staff, rooms are average, but equipped with TV, and A/C. The pool area is nice, and beach areas are within walking distance. Mattress on the bed was not great, but overall recommend this hotel for a good place to stay for a night or two.

Reviews.Title: “small, but clean and affordable”
Reviews.Author: dozer037
Reviews.Content: We just needed a place to stay for the night before we flew out. I prefer staying at smaller quaint places with personality, rather than hotel chains. Going by trip advisor recommendations, I thought I'd give this place a shot. I couldn't believe the price! San Juan prices were all high, and at $90 a night, I was a little nervous about what I was getting in to. But it wasn't bad! Pros are the bar, the pool, the patio upstairs, the cleanliness. The staff was nice, and it was close to the beach. There's a cafe on the corner across the street to get coffee in the morning. Cons: It was difficult getting the luggage up the stairs. Whatever they use to clean the bathrooms smelled way too strong, almost nauseating, so we bought some incense and it made the smell go away. No coffee in the rooms or in the lobby. The air conditioner was a little loud, but it turned out good for drowning out the sounds of the airport. If you don't plan to spend too much time in the room it was sufficient just to sleep. The bathroom was small, but the shower had pretty good pressure and water was hot. All in all, I would stay there again, but I would check out the bigger more expensive rooms if I needed more than one night.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Surprise!”
Reviews.Author: aevegan
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a beautiful surprise. Its nestled away next to all the big names in Isla Verde, for a fraction of the price. After a short (and terrible) stay at the Howard Johnson, I found this hotel for the remainder of our 5 day stay. The staff was incredibly friendly and helpful. The bartender was especially nice! The hotel is pretty new with a nice pool and location. The rooms were super clean everyday of our stay, no matter how messey we made it. Its close to the beach and airport. (Althought it is close to the airport, the noise is not audible inside the room, only outside. Overall, I loved the place. I'll stay there everytime I go to San Juan. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Had a Hard time Sleeping”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I book the rm for 3 days and 2 nights but regret it because the bed was not confortable at all. I could'nt sleep at all on that first night, there was no cushing to the bed and it seem that I was sleeping on a Hard Cardboard box. It was a nightmare. As for the second night, I did not sleep there at all but, I did have some friend's come over and had a blast with them.

Reviews.Title: “I would highly recommend it!”
Reviews.Author: awegs
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at Villa Del Sol for 3 nights and I really enjoyed my stay. It IS NOT a fancy or swank hotel. But it is clean, safe, the employees were extremely friendly, and the location is second to none. It is literally right next door to the El Suan Juan Hotel, which in my opinion, is the nicest hotel in Isla Verde. It is also a quick 3-4 minute walk to the beach. If you are on a budget and want to stay in Isla Verde, this is your place.

Reviews.Title: “Would not recommend Villa del Sol”
Reviews.Author: lopeytt
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a reservation to stay here for one night. We checked into our room and lugged our furniture up the stairs (no elevator). The sheets on the bed were thin and rough and there was no mattress pad. My husband went downstairs to ask for a mattress pad and after 10 minutes someone came and threw one in his lap. We then conferred with each other and decided to try and stay somewhere else. When we went to the clerk and told her we would not be staying there for the night she said she would not refund our money because it took us "over 10 minutes" to let her know we would not be staying. I told her that she had never informed me of the ten-minute rule and asked if there was a manager on duty. She said no. I asked if there was a manager she could call that I could talk to. She called someone, supposedly the manager, and spoke in Spanish to this person, but would not let me get on the phone. She told me they were still going to charge us for the night because it had taken us 20 minutes to let her know. We immediately called our credit card company and filed a complaint. They assured us we would not have to pay the charge. Bad, bad experience. We went to the Embassy Suites across the street and paid $200 more, but it was worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Decent small hotel for first few nights in town”
Reviews.Author: lunettes_noires
Reviews.Content: Pros: - Rooms were recently remodeled and clean - Staff was nice and helpful (although you often had to wait for them to finish a phone call first) - 5 minute drive from airport and 5 minute walk to beach Cons: - Just next to flight path for incoming jets. Noise was not unbearable due to dual-pane windows, but still noticeable. Could also hear people in neighboring room. - Pool closed after 6pm - Our room had some broken light fixtures which weren't fixed during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Home Away From Home”
Reviews.Author: keigh31
Reviews.Content: For the third year we (entire men's softball team, wives and children) have stayed at Villa Del Sol in Isla Verde Puerto Rico during the Thanksgiving Holiday season. It is our home away from home. The atmosphere is awesome and the hotel is steps away from Isla Verde Beach. You can walk to casinos and the area is pretty safe. The hotel staff is wonderful. Carmen the bartendender is particularly attentive to all guests.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely small hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a weekend to visit my family. Was pretty cool, walked to the beach every morning, pretty clean, drinks were pretty inexpensive compared to the other hotels ive stayed in Isla Verde.

Reviews.Title: “It's a wonderful place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I loved our stay (5 nights) at Hotel Villa Del Sol. We didn't have a prior reservation, but they managed to accommodate us and give us excellent rates. When I walked in, I asked one of the employees regarding their amenities; she included the employees as one. At the time, I was a bit skeptical due to our interaction with other hotel employees, but she was absolutely right. We were treated wonderfully. Donâ€™t forget to try Annetteâ€™s margaritas and Carmenâ€™s Pina Colladas (?). Villa Del Sol is cute, clean and affordable. This place has a lot of character. You will definitely enjoy your stay. FYI, the car rental guy, Carlos (he is not one of their employees), was the only unpleasant person we dealt with at the hotel. You might want to stay away from him.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Villa del Sol”
Reviews.Author: sweetiepie17
Reviews.Content: Me and my best friends stayed at Hotel Villa del Sol for five days and, we had a great time!! Before booking the hotel I had read the reviews in this site, and I was terrified to go there, but this was a very affordable hotel and we booked it in spite of all the bad reviews. I must admit I was pleasantly surprise! This hotel, first of all, is small, but beautiful. The hotel staff was always courteous. The bar had all the drinks we wanted at a very low price. The pool was small but always warm and clean. The room was spaceous, and clean. The beach is very close. We all had a great time!!

Reviews.Title: “Just Fine for a Night or Two”
Reviews.Author: Perki
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for one day/night for a stop over going to St. Martin. Coming from Las Vegas it is a LONG day flying to the Caribbean, so we decided to chop up the flight down and stay here before flying out the next morning for a week in St. Martin. For a night or two I would say it is perfect, cost was around $110/nt at the end of April and was about 5 minutes to/from the airport. It is only 1 or 2 blocks from the beach and there were several restaurants/bars right there at the beach that we enjoyed. Rooms are very basic, but with the other hotel rooms going for almost $200/nt for not much better (from what I have read) this place is perfect for a short stay - any longer I would pay more and stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “great vacation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: i had a great time at this hotel, the atmoshpere was so relaxing, we didn't have a problem with anything. the room was perfect all the time, it was near the beach, the pool was great.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible, Horrible”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Reservations were made by my future sister-inlaw, as our whole family traveled to PR for a family wedding OCT '03. She was never told that hotel was to be under construction. Lobby was constantly drapped in big plastic tarps. Constant flooding occured in lobby at the foot of the stairs After traveling to PR for many hours we were informed that the bar /restaurant would not be open for food or refreshments. Our group of 19 decided to have food and drinks brought in. This bar'restaurant was rarely open in the 5 days we were there. The following day a sign was posted throughout the hotel stating that no food or beverages could be brought in from the outside. Moldy puddles of long standing water surrounded part of the pool area. Terrible part of town, sounds of people being beaten up at night. Furniture throughtout hotel in state of disrepair. Hotel staff never put themselves out to assist with any problems. Ruined what was a long anticipated trip!! SHOULD BE CLOSED DOWN!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare from hell!!!”
Reviews.Author: ilaureb
Reviews.Content: Our experience with Hotel Villa del Sol was absolutely a nightmare from hell. The first night we found out that my pillowcase had blood stains. Then our toilet flooded the following day. We did not receive new towels 2 nights in a row...despite many visits to the front desk to ask for towels. Our fourth night the toilet flooded again. We reported it, once again, to the front desk and they just dried the floor and left. No apologies!! No nothing! And of course, our sixth and last night the toilet flooded one more time. But this time with more impetus and got some of our clothes wet. We once again visited the front desk. But since the incident happened after hours we had to wait until someone could come in and clean it. The manager came in and they just cleaned the floor. I demanded a new room!!! The manager gave us a room on the 3rd floor (no elevator!!) and didn't even bother to help us with our luggage or even apologize for the great inconvenience that this caused. Oh! Before I forget, I asked for an extra bed at the front desk and after paying for it, they told they'd bring it in. Two hours later I had not received my extra bed. I went to the front desk and the worker asked me to "go and pick it up myself from the storage room". Lastly, they charged a service fee when we checked out, I assume because of the toilet!! Anyway, this may all seem unbelievable, but it's true! Please don't make the mistake of staying at this hotel. For $92 a night you could find something better. Don't do it!!!!

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Villa del Sol
HotelInfo.Address: 4 Calle Rosa, Isla Verde 00979, Puerto Rico
